duties_responsibilities.duty: Execute hybrid manufacturing salaried and hourly recruiting strategy in the assigned region, focusing on recruitment process optimization and customer-centricity.
Strengthen the People strategy in North America through support of salaried and hourly talent acquisition strategies in multiple manufacturing locations within the assigned region.
Reduce time-to-fill, candidate turnover, and enhance current local market bench strength within the assigned region.

Work closely with Regional Recruiting Manager to identify and attract qualified and diverse candidates, screen and schedule candidates for interviews, oversee pre-employment processing, and track and document metrics for continuous improvement.
Combine strategic HR, Talent Acquisition, and related disciplines to serve effectively as a critical resource in the hourly recruitment space.
Build relationships with key stakeholders in the assigned region, and communicate openly with all candidates, hiring managers, and human resources teams.
Set up tracking tools to document data related to posting, sourcing, screening, scheduling, and pre-employment activities by location and position.

Identify sources for posting and sourcing candidates, ensure follow-up for most productive postings, and maximize the use of search channels, networks, diversity channels, social media, and university relationships.
Manage recruitment event planning and attendance, screen new applications timely, and conduct virtual/telephone interviews with qualified candidates for hiring consideration.
Ensure best-in-class candidate experience through effective communication, timely contact, and follow-up with all potential candidates.

Problem-solve and react quickly to concerns/issues presented in all stages of the recruitment life cycle, prepare, evaluate, and share data of productivity and effectiveness through regular distribution of defined, pre-identified performance indicators.

Identify areas for improvement and best practices across the region, participate and collaborate on assigned projects, and promote the client's attitudes and follow the guiding principles of conduct and action.
Perform other related duties and responsibilities as directed by the Regional Recruiting Manager.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in a related discipline (Master's preferred)
Bi-lingual (English and French, for north region)
